description:
GDH Consulting is looking for a Content Marketing Manager – Social & Analytics to work remotely.

Who You'll Work With

In this role, you can expect to work with engineering, design, and scientists in defining and executing the product plan.

What You'll Do
• Support coordinating all aspects of content strategy alongside our leadership, including content ideation, author management, scheduling, publishing, and promotion plans.
• Own posting, monitoring, and engaging on our social channels, helping facilitate incoming requests from cross-functional teams alongside running our social strategy
• Work cross-functionally with ET&Is various content creators and teams to ensure they are empowered to create and publish high-quality content.
• Contribute to new and creative ways for the customer to share content and ideas across a myriad of media types, from shorts on TikTok and Youtube to cross-posting opportunities across the organization.
• Execute via a data-driven approach to tracking and measuring content performance assisting with analysis and reporting on SEO progress, link monitoring, engagement data, etc.
• Lead monthly and Quarterly Analytics reporting across multiple channels and from various sources.

Who You Are
• You are an experienced content practitioner who has owned and managed content marketing programs for an organization, from running editorial standards and programs to successfully growing multimedia content experiences in-market.
• You have experience in SaaS, cloud-native software, or even cloud-native security; this might be for developer audiences and/or CxO audiences alike.
• You build strong cross-functional relationships to ensure consistency of output across an organizations content platforms, and ensure all business efforts consistently reflect that strategy.
• You ponder the finer arts of SEO (especially in an AI-search world), embrace data and employ data to drive content development decisions and prove ROI of your programs.
• You are creative, and always look for ways to bring the unexpected, delightful, never-been-seen-before angle to both large and small content experiences for customers.
• Bachelor's Degree required (diverse subject matter welcome).
